faq.question: What are the available courses at Amrita Chennai Campus?
faq.answer: Amrita Chennai Campus offers B.Tech, M.Tech, MBA, MSc, PhD, and other UG & PG programs. Visit https://www.amrita.edu for details.

faq.question: What are the B.Tech specializations offered at Amrita Chennai?
faq.answer: B.Tech specializations include CSE, AI, Cyber Security, ECE, Mechanical, Civil, and Electrical Engineering.

faq.question: Does Amrita offer B.Sc programs?
faq.answer: Yes, Amrita Chennai offers B.Sc programs in Data Science, Biotechnology, and Physics.

faq.question: What is the admission process for B.Tech?
faq.answer: Admission is based on AEEE, JEE Mains, or SAT scores. Candidates must apply online at https://www.amrita.edu/admissions.

faq.question: How can I register for AEEE?
faq.answer: You can register for AEEE through the official website: https://www.amrita.edu/admissions/aeee.

faq.question: What is the syllabus for AEEE?
faq.answer: The AEEE syllabus includes Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, and English from the 12th-grade curriculum.

faq.question: What are the eligibility criteria for M.Tech?
faq.answer: Candidates must have a B.Tech/B.E degree in a relevant discipline with at least 60% aggregate. GATE scores are preferred.

faq.question: Does Amrita Chennai offer direct admission?
faq.answer: Yes, a few seats are available under the NRI/Management quota. Contact the admission office for details.

faq.question: What is the fee structure for B.Tech?
faq.answer: The tuition fee varies based on the branch and scholarship eligibility. Visit https://www.amrita.edu for detailed fees.

faq.question: Are scholarships available for merit students?
faq.answer: Yes, scholarships are provided based on AEEE/JEE ranks, academic performance, and financial need.

faq.question: What are the hostel facilities at Amrita Chennai?
faq.answer: The campus provides separate hostels for boys and girls with Wi-Fi, mess, laundry, and recreational areas.

faq.question: Is hostel accommodation mandatory?
faq.answer: No, students can choose to stay off-campus, but hostel accommodation is recommended for convenience.

faq.question: Are non-vegetarian meals available in the hostel?
faq.answer: No, the hostel mess serves only vegetarian meals.

faq.question: What are the library facilities available?
faq.answer: The campus library has a large collection of books, research papers, e-books, and digital resources.

faq.question: Does Amrita provide transportation services?
faq.answer: Yes, Amrita offers bus services from key locations across Chennai.

faq.question: What are the campus placement statistics?

faq.question: What kind of research opportunities are available?

faq.question: Does Amrita Chennai provide study-abroad opportunities?

faq.question: explain the seat allotment process
faq.answer: Amrita University will contact successful candidates for seats provisionally based on their rank in the entrance exam. Candidates are to ensure their phones are on and charged during allotted times between 10am to 12pm. Documents, including photos and certificates, must be emailed to the university on the same day as the call before 5pm. Fees must be paid within 48 working hours of document verification, or the provisional allotment will be cancelled.

faq.question: How is the verification of the certificates done
faq.answer: Certificate verification is an important process used to confirm the authenticity, and therefore the validity of the information contained in a certificate. The process can involve a variety of methods, depending on the type of certificate and the issuing authority. Visual inspection, cross-referencing of information, contacting issuing authorities, online verification portals, blockchain technology, digital certificates and QR codes, third-party verification services, and legal and notarial processes can all be used. Which methods are used for a particular certificate will depend on its type and its issuing authority.

faq.question: What is the Phase-1 counselling schedule
faq.answer: Amrita University's Phase-1 online counselling has not listed a specific schedule. However, it does advise candidates to be available for counselling on their registered mobile number between 10:00 am to 12:00 noon according to their rank order. Candidates must have their original documents ready and keep their phones charged and accessible during this time. For any updates, candidates should check the university's admission page.

faq.question: What is the annual fee details of BSc Anaesthesia  Technology (AT)
faq.answer: The annual fees for BSc Anaesthesia Technology are split into merit, management, and NRI categories. The fees range from 140,000 INR to 190,000 INR, plus a fixed fee of 37,450 INR for the first year. For NRIs, the tuition is 3,000 USD plus the fixed fee in INR. These fees do not include hostel and mess fees of 60,000 INR payable at the time of student onboarding.
